001package ca.gc.cra.radar.infrastructure.capture.libpcap;
002
003import ca.gc.cra.radar.infrastructure.capture.libpcap.cstruct.BpfProgramStruct;
004import jnr.ffi.Pointer;
005
006/**
007 * JNR-FFI bindings for the subset of libpcap APIs used by RADAR.
008 * <p>Methods map directly to the native {@code pcap_*} functions and are not thread-safe.</p>
009 *
010 * @since RADAR 0.1-doc
011 */
012public interface JnrLibpcap {
013  /**
014   * Shared library instance used by RADAR capture adapters.
015   *
016   * @since RADAR 0.1-doc
017   */
018  JnrLibpcap INSTANCE = jnr.ffi.LibraryLoader.create(JnrLibpcap.class).load("pcap");
019
020  /**
021   * Wraps {@code pcap_create} to allocate a capture handle for the given device.
022   *
023   * @param source network device (e.g., {@code "eth0"})
024   * @param errbuf pointer to an error buffer
025   * @return pointer to an unactivated {@code pcap_t} handle or {@code null} on failure
026   * @since RADAR 0.1-doc
027   */
028  Pointer pcap_create(String source, Pointer errbuf);
029
030  /**
031   * Sets the snapshot length prior to activation.
032   *
033   * @param p handle returned by {@link #pcap_create(String, Pointer)}
034   * @param snaplen maximum bytes per packet to capture
035   * @return zero on success; negative on failure
036   * @since RADAR 0.1-doc
037   */
038  int pcap_set_snaplen(Pointer p, int snaplen);
039
040  /**
041   * Toggles promiscuous mode.
042   *
043   * @param p capture handle
044   * @param promisc {@code 1} to enable, {@code 0} to disable
045   * @return zero on success; negative on failure
046   * @since RADAR 0.1-doc
047   */
048  int pcap_set_promisc(Pointer p, int promisc);
049
050  /**
051   * Sets the read timeout in milliseconds.
052   *
053   * @param p capture handle
054   * @param to_ms timeout in milliseconds
055   * @return zero on success; negative on failure
056   * @since RADAR 0.1-doc
057   */
058  int pcap_set_timeout(Pointer p, int to_ms);
059
060  /**
061   * Sets the capture buffer size in bytes.
062   *
063   * @param p capture handle
064   * @param bytes requested buffer size in bytes
065   * @return zero on success; negative on failure
066   * @since RADAR 0.1-doc
067   */
068  int pcap_set_buffer_size(Pointer p, int bytes);
069
070  /**
071   * Enables or disables immediate mode on the capture handle.
072   *
073   * @param p capture handle
074   * @param on {@code 1} to enable immediate mode; {@code 0} to disable
075   * @return zero on success; negative on failure
076   * @since RADAR 0.1-doc
077   */
078  int pcap_set_immediate_mode(Pointer p, int on);
079
080  /**
081   * Activates the capture handle created via {@link #pcap_create(String, Pointer)}.
082   *
083   * @param p capture handle
084   * @return zero when activation succeeds; positive warning or negative error otherwise
085   * @since RADAR 0.1-doc
086   */
087  int pcap_activate(Pointer p);
088
089  /**
090   * Compiles a BPF filter expression.
091   *
092   * @param p capture handle
093   * @param prog program structure populated by libpcap
094   * @param filter filter expression in tcpdump syntax
095   * @param optimize non-zero to ask libpcap to optimize
096   * @param netmask IPv4 netmask used for filter optimization
097   * @return zero on success; negative on failure
098   * @since RADAR 0.1-doc
099   */
100  int pcap_compile(Pointer p, BpfProgramStruct prog, String filter, int optimize, int netmask);
101
102  /**
103   * Applies a compiled BPF program to the capture handle.
104   *
105   * @param p capture handle
106   * @param prog compiled program produced by {@link #pcap_compile(Pointer, BpfProgramStruct, String, int, int)}
107   * @return zero on success; negative on failure
108   * @since RADAR 0.1-doc
109   */
110  int pcap_setfilter(Pointer p, BpfProgramStruct prog);
111
112  /**
113   * Releases a compiled BPF program.
114   *
115   * @param prog compiled program to free
116   * @since RADAR 0.1-doc
117   */
118  void pcap_freecode(BpfProgramStruct prog);
119
120  /**
121   * Reads the next available packet.
122   *
123   * @param p capture handle
124   * @param hdr_pp pointer-to-pointer receiving the packet header
125   * @param data_pp pointer-to-pointer receiving the packet payload
126   * @return libpcap status code (1 packet, 0 timeout, -1 error, -2 EOF)
127   * @since RADAR 0.1-doc
128   */
129  int pcap_next_ex(Pointer p, Pointer hdr_pp, Pointer data_pp);
130
131  /**
132   * Retrieves the last error string for the handle.
133   *
134   * @param p capture handle
135   * @return human-readable error message
136   * @since RADAR 0.1-doc
137   */
138  String pcap_geterr(Pointer p);
139
140  /**
141   * Closes a capture handle.
142   *
143   * @param p capture handle to close
144   * @since RADAR 0.1-doc
145   */
146  void pcap_close(Pointer p);
147
148  /**
149   * Returns the libpcap version string as reported by {@code pcap_lib_version}.
150   *
151   * @return libpcap version string as reported by {@code pcap_lib_version}
152   * @since RADAR 0.1-doc
153   */
154  String pcap_lib_version();
155}
